{"id":946111518,"question_id":2780,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"1 year, 1 month","timestamp":1683470914,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"10 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/946111518/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Make Costs of Paths Equal in a Binary Tree","memory":"55.1 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    int res = 0;\n    public int minIncrements(int n, int[] cost) {\n       \n        dfs(0, cost);\n        return res;\n    }\n    private int dfs(int i, int[] cost) {\n        if (i >= cost.length) return 0;\n        int a = dfs(2 * i + 1, cost), b = dfs(2 * i + 2, cost);\n        res += Math.abs(a - b);\n        return cost[i] + Math.max(a, b);\n    }\n}\n\n        \n        \n        // 100\n         // 200 300\n             \n             \n             //  300\n        \n//                             764\n//                     1460                 2664\n//                 764   2725             4556    5305\n//             8829  5064   5929 7660  6321  4830  7055 3761              \n        \n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"make-costs-of-paths-equal-in-a-binary-tree","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
